prompt: Create an animated SVG loading spinner that looks premium and modern. Pure SVG, no external libraries.
expectations: Output is a valid SVG file with xmlns attribute
Output contains viewBox attribute (not just static width/height)
Animation uses SMIL animateTransform or CSS @keyframes
repeatCount='indefinite' or animation-iteration-count:infinite is present
Design has visual style beyond a plain gray circle — uses color or gradient
No external dependencies or library imports
Animation uses easing (calcMode spline or CSS cubic-bezier)

prompt: Make an animated SVG of a morphing blob shape that changes form continuously. Use vivid colors.
expectations: Output contains an animate element with attributeName='d' (path morphing)
Both/all path values in the morph have identical command structure
Animation loops indefinitely
Color is vivid — gradient or saturated fill, not plain gray or black
Background is not plain white — uses dark or gradient fill
At least one easing curve is applied to the morph

prompt: Create an animated SVG that draws a signature or logo using the stroke dashoffset technique.
expectations: stroke-dasharray and stroke-dashoffset are both present
A keyframe or animate element transitions stroke-dashoffset to 0
Path has stroke styling (fill:none or minimal, stroke with color)
Animation has a natural drawing feel — not instant
Output is self-contained SVG with no external dependencies

prompt: Build an animated SVG particle field — 30+ dots floating and connecting with lines when near each other.
expectations: Output contains a <script> block using createElementNS for SVG element creation
CDATA wrapper is present around script content
requestAnimationFrame is used for the animation loop
At least 30 particles are created
Connection lines drawn between nearby particles based on distance
Dark background is used to make particles visible

prompt: Create an animated SVG bar chart where the bars rise up with a staggered entrance animation.
expectations: At least 4 bar elements are present
Bars animate from scale 0 to 1 (scaleY) or height 0 to full height
Stagger delays are applied so bars rise one after another
transform-origin is set to bottom of bars so they grow upward
Animation has bounce or overshoot easing (cubic-bezier with >1 values or spring-like)
Design uses color — not plain gray bars
